name: Emergency Help Workflow
description: Emergency response workflow for checking on the user, administering epipen and coordinating with 911. This is a structured workflow - follow each step sequentially using get_next_step() and complete_step(). Do not skip steps or deviate from the workflow structure.
author: team

nodes.intent: Navigate to the person in need. Use navigate_to_person() to move the robot to the person's location so the epipen can be administered. This will locate the person using pose detection, rotate to their thigh, and drive forward to an appropriate interaction distance. IMPORTANT: Only call navigate_to_person() - do NOT call emergency services or update any state variables yet. After navigation is complete, call complete_step() with NO state updates (empty dict or null).

Ask the person if they are okay. Check on their condition verbally and wait for their response. Speak directly to them: 'Are you okay? Do you need medical assistance?' IMPORTANT: After getting their response, call complete_step() with state_updates containing ONLY 'user_is_okay' set to true (if they say they're fine or 'yes') or false (if they say no, don't respond, or indicate they need help). Do NOT update any other state variables.

The person says they are fine. Revert to normal operational state and exit the emergency workflow. Call toggle_state('normal') to switch back to normal mode, then call complete_step() with NO state updates to end the workflow.

The person says they are not okay or did not respond. Call 911 emergency services and switch to emergency mode. IMPORTANT: First call call_emergency_services(), then call toggle_state('emergency'). After both are done, call complete_step() with state_updates containing ONLY 'call_911_success' set to true (if call succeeded) or false (if call failed). Do NOT update operator_says_administer or any other state variables here.

The 911 call failed. Administer the epipen immediately as a fallback measure. Call administer_epipen(), then call complete_step() with NO state updates to end the workflow (you remain in emergency mode).

The 911 call succeeded. Communicate with the 911 operator through the audio connection. Describe the current state of the person in detail: their condition, whether they're conscious, their breathing, and any visible symptoms. Listen carefully to the operator's instructions. IMPORTANT: After communicating with the operator and getting their instructions, call complete_step() with state_updates containing ONLY 'operator_says_administer' set to true (if they explicitly tell you to administer the epipen) or false (if they say emergency team is coming, wait for paramedics, or don't instruct you to administer). Do NOT update any other state variables here.

The 911 operator has instructed you to administer the epipen. Do so immediately. Call administer_epipen(), then call complete_step() with state_updates containing ONLY 'epipen_administered' set to true. Do NOT update user_confirmed_okay yet.

After administering the epipen, confirm that the user is okay. Check their condition visually and verbally ask: 'How are you feeling? Are you feeling better?' Wait for their response. IMPORTANT: After getting their response, call complete_step() with state_updates containing ONLY 'user_confirmed_okay' set to true (if they say they're okay, feeling better, or yes) or false (if they say no, still not well, or don't respond). Do NOT update any other state variables.

The user confirmed they are okay after epipen administration. Exit the emergency workflow and switch back to normal operational mode. Call toggle_state('normal'), then call complete_step() with NO state updates to end the workflow.

Inform the patient that the emergency team is coming. Stay put and provide reassurance while waiting for help. Call complete_step() with NO state updates to end the workflow (you remain in emergency mode).
